channel.title: How
channel.description: how do you change what the teleporting sell says in game and where it teles?

item.title: How
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

[quote=“watch n lern, post:15, topic:363490”][quote author=usman555 link=topic=459737.msg3364089#msg3364089 date=1286645277]

[quote author=watch n lern link=topic=459737.msg3364079#msg3364079 date=1286645006]

You don’t judge people by reputation. If I got 132 rep, and I’m stupid, my rep doesn’t matter.

obviously…

I also don’t believe the text files part. Let me test it out?
EDIT:
If text files get ignored by compilers, and work anyways, then what’s the need for a compiler?

go ahead. and thats because they are coded in as .JAVA files not .TXT smart ass
[/quote]LOL You don’t know shit. Gtfo and learn java.

your the dumb shit that didnt even know you could have text files with extra information in them without getting errors. you’ve probably never coded a thing in your life. gtfo and l2 code kid.
[/quote]Text files are for extra information. You are changing a text file and expecting the server to change.
Theres a confusion here. Let me clear things up a bit:

Text files are for organization.
Text files do not cause compiling errors.
Text files will not change your server if you modify them.
Java files will change your server if you modify them.
Java files will cause compiling errors if coded the wrong way.
Java files are for modifying and working on your project.
Conventions in java files will organize what you are writing.
Reputation is just a number, it doesn’t matter if I have 132 rep, and you have 25 rep.

If you disagree on this, then don’t post, forget this thread, let me learn on my own.

that’s pretty much exactly what ive been saying…[/quote]We’ve probably been confused. Now lets let this thread die.

Read full topic

item.title: How
item.dc:creator: @watch_n_lern watch n lern
item.description:
@watch_n_lern wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:7, topic:363490”][quote author=watch n lern link=topic=459737.msg3363986#msg3363986 date=1286638111]

[quote author=usman555 link=topic=459737.msg3363983#msg3363983 date=1286637917]

First off, go to your “Notes” folder and find a text document called “Interface text.txt” then search for whatever teleport you would like to change, say varrok - 1300. Okay, now go to texthandler.java.
Add this code in there:

c.sendQuest("TeleportNameHere", 1300); c.sendQuest("Description of Tele", 1301); c.sendQuest("TeleportNameHere", 13037); c.sendQuest("Description of Tele", 13038);
[/quote]How did you guess he has a “notes” folder? Nevermind an “Interface text” file?

if its 317 then he has it unless some kid with down’s syndrome deleted it before he dled.
[/quote]Most 317’s don’t have a notes folder. And how do you know he has a 317? And also, .txt files won’t work because they need to be compiled as .JAVA files.[/quote]

Wow then you must have down’s syndrome. i didnt say i KNOW he has it… i said “IF” and text files do work… they dont have to be compiled as .java files if they arent being loaded from a file in the source, they are just ignored and will not cause errors… how in the hell do you have 132 rep?

Read full topic

item.title: How
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

I don’t know what source you have, so this might not work.

In order to change what the teleport says, you are going to want to go to textHandler.java, and search for the name (example: varrock) and change it to what you want.

Now in order to change where the teleport brings you to, you want to search for the exact case in the clickingMost.java (There are a lot, an easy way to find which one is by testing it in your client, when you click on the teleport, it will tell you what case it is in your command prompt).

Under the case, you might see something like

c.triggerTele(2985, 3857, 0);

The first set of numbers is the x coordinate, the second is y coordinate, and the third is height. Chang the numbers to the location you want.

Read full topic
